'''System requirements''' refers to the hardware and software [[w:Specification (technical standard)|specifications]] that a device must meet in order to play a [[w:Video game|video game]].

== ''Minecraft'' ==
The system requirements for ''Minecraft'' vary between different editions on the game. The requirements for each edition are explained on that edition's page. Here is a list of links to the "System requirements" section of each edition's page:
* ''[[Bedrock Edition#System requirements|Bedrock Edition]]''
** Simply titled ''Minecraft''. This edition is available on most platforms.
* ''[[Java Edition#System requirements|Java Edition]]''
** Titled ''Minecraft: Java Edition'', this edition is only available on personal computers.
* ''[[Minecraft Education#System requirements|Minecraft Education]]''
** An educational edition of ''Minecraft'' designed for classroom use.
* ''[[China Edition#System requirements|China Edition]]''
** A release of ''Minecraft'' that is only available in mainland China.
* [[Legacy Console Edition]]
** This edition doesn't have any system requirements, because it was released with specific editions designed for specific console systems.

== ''Minecraft'' spin-offs ==
The ''Minecraft'' spin-off games have their own system requirements too:
* ''[[Minecraft Dungeons#System requirements|Minecraft Dungeons]]''
** an action-adventure role-playing video game
* ''[[Minecraft Legends#System requirements|Minecraft Legends]]''
** an action strategy video game
* ''[[Minecraft Earth#System requirements|Minecraft Earth]]''
** a free-to-play augmented reality (AR) spin-off mobile game
* ''[[Minecraft: Story Mode#System requirements|Minecraft: Story Mode]]'' / ''[[Minecraft: Story Mode - Season Two#System requirements|Minecraft: Story Mode - Season Two]]''
** episodic point-and-click narrative-driven graphic adventure video games
